Submodules¶

model_data_base.IO.dask_wrappers module¶

model_data_base.IO.dask_wrappers.concat_path_elements_to_filelist(*args)[source]¶

e.g. args = [‘str’, [1,2,3], pd.Series([1,2,3])] > [[‘str’, ‘str’, ‘str’], [1, 2, 3], [1, 2, 3]]

model_data_base.IO.dask_wrappers.my_reader(fname, fun)[source]¶
model_data_base.IO.dask_wrappers.read_csvs(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

The native dask read_csv function only supports globstrings. Use this function instead, if you want to provide a explicit filelist.

model_data_base.IO.roberts_formats module¶

model_data_base.IO.roberts_formats.read_InputMapper_summary(pathOrBuffer, sep='\t')[source]¶

Expects the path to a summary csv file of the Single Cell Mapper, returns the tables as pandas tables

model_data_base.IO.roberts_formats.read_csv_uneven_length(path, n_commas, header=None, skiprows=0)[source]¶

general function to read in a csv file with varying length data.

Parameters

  • path – path to file

  • n_commas – maximum length of fields

kwargs:

header: you can provide an alternative header skiprows: skip rows at the beginning of the file (e.g. one to skip the

header if you specified one manually)

model_data_base.IO.roberts_formats.read_pandas_cell_activation_from_roberts_format(path, sim_trail_index='no_sim_trail_assigned', max_commas=None, set_index=True)[source]¶

reads cell activation file from simulation and converts it to pandas table

model_data_base.IO.roberts_formats.read_pandas_synapse_activation_from_roberts_format(path, sim_trail_index='no_sim_trail_assigned', max_commas=None, set_index=True)[source]¶

reads synapse activation file from simulation and converts it to pandas table

model_data_base.IO.roberts_formats.write_pandas_synapse_activation_to_roberts_format(path, syn_activation)[source]¶

save pandas df in a format, which can be understood by the simulator
